important_phrase: District crude oil   production continued to increase moderately in November through mid-December,   with the number of rigs operating in the Gulf of Mexico up slightly from lows   seen in August
Prices remained relatively stable for most businesses
However,   holiday-related hiring also appeared to be weaker than normal
Most banking contacts noted that   credit standards remained relatively tight for most types of loans
Transportation contacts indicated that freight   demand remained weak but had modestly improved over the past month
The   near-term outlook among most contacts improved modestly
Tourism-related spending remained sluggish throughout the District
The outlook remains   cautious
Having reduced employment levels over the past year, most contacts are now   holding domestic headcounts relatively steady or increasing them modestly
Median   prices declined modestly year-over-year in New Hampshire and Maine, while   increasing by about 1 percent in Massachusetts and Rhode Island
Same-store sales vary from flat to positive mid-single-digits year-over-year
Weat,   milk, and hog prices also increased, whereas corn and cattle prices decreased   from the previous reporting period
Manufacturing improved, but construction remained weak
Price pressures increased for raw   materials in December
Credit conditions improved marginally   in December
Manufacturing activity improved in   December
Residential development picked up slightly for   single-family homes, but remained at a low level for condominiums and townhomes
Consumer spending increased in   December
Spot prices for oil are stable within a narrow range, while those for natural   gas were up a little
Otherwise, raw   material and product pricing were relatively stable
Interest margins are steady to   slightly up
Most of our contacts   expressed uncertainty about near-term activity and expect only modest   improvements in volume during 2010
A majority of   contractors now expect at least a slight improvement in activity during 2010
Several dealers cited lean inventories and   difficulties in obtaining floor-plan financing as reasons for low sales
Nearly all crops have been harvested, and the crop outlook   for 2010 has improved
Wile conditions   appeared to be recovering in many sectors and outlooks were becoming more   positive, most contacts only expected a slow and modest improvement in the near   term
There were also reports of   slight increases in crop and industrial metal prices
Loan demand remained soft
Stffing firms said demand for contract work   continued to improve but orders for direct hires were flat at low levels
Outlooks are modestly optimistic
The outlook is cautiously   optimistic, with contacts expecting a slow recovery in business
Agricultural conditions improved since the   last survey period
The Tenth District economy expanded more modestly in late November and   December than in the previous survey period
Price pressures were modest, and wage   pressures remained limited due to weak labor markets
Deposits were essentially unchanged, following several months of steady   growth
Overall growth in factory production slowed,   while employment remained essentially flat
Housing starts dampened slightly,   as several builders noted continued financing difficulties, but expectations   improved from the previous survey
Consumer spending growth softened   somewhat from the previous survey
Agricultural activity declined
Labor markets remained weak, but the pace of job losses has slowed
Labor markets remained   weak, but the pace of job losses has slowed
Manufacturing output was mixed
Commercial construction was   flat at low levels
Consumer spending increased   modestly
Agricultural prices have been mixed
Toward the end of 2009, home sales increased in most Districts, especially   for lower-priced homes
However, Boston reported some modest pay increases, and   Minneapolis indicated that wages in that District have been level or rising   moderately
Loan demand continued to decline or   remained weak in most Districts
Production was stable   or slightly up in the Cleveland District
In the Atlanta District, existing home sales increased, but new   home sales decreased
The New York, Atlanta, and Kansas City Districts also reported flat or   weaker tourism
The Second District's economy has shown further signs of improvement since   the last report, with indications of a modest pickup in the labor market; prices   remain relatively stable
For all loan categories, respondents continue to   indicate tightening of credit standards

A major New York City employment   agency, specializing in office jobs, reports that hiring activity has picked up   a bit--primarily from the city's financial industry--during what is usually a   slow season
Office markets in upstate   New York were generally stable, on balance, with faint signs of improvement in   the Buffalo and Albany areas but modest softening in metropolitan Rochester
Retailers generally report that   holiday-season sales were little changed from 2008 levels but moderately ahead   of plan, as many stores carried significantly lower inventories than last year
Motor vehicle dealers   indicated that sales have improved slightly
Reports on input costs and output prices have been   mixed since the last Beige Book
Looking ahead, Third District bankers see slow loan growth starting around   mid-year as the economy recovers and loan demand picks up
Firms reporting   increases in orders generally indicated that the gains have been slight
One   contact said that "slower general business activity has resulted in many   properties not generating cash flow
Some Third District auto dealers reported improvement in sales in December,   although, for most, sales have been roughly steady
On the more   positive side, both import and export activity at District ports improved, and   banking activity received a modest boost, particularly from increased lending   for equipment
A Hagerstown agent   expected stronger demand for workers due to a slight improvement in the overall   economy
Loan demand was generally described as either   unchanged or slightly higher since our last report, with modest gains noted   particularly for equipment spending
Contacts reported that raw materials prices increased at a slower pace   and finished goods prices changed little from a month ago

One agent noted that national retail   chains, attracted to the relatively low unemployment rates across the District,   were actively seeking new sites in anticipation of an expansion in retail   spending when the economy improved
Revenues generally declined at retail businesses   in recent weeks, although a few contacts reported some improvement in sales
Sales   expanded for assorted crops, and inputs remained readily available with   generally stable prices noted
Manufacturing activity continued at very low levels for some product lines but   appeared to improve further on balance
Upward price pressures were quite   limited during the reporting period
Further small improvements in venture capital   funding and IPO activity were noted
District manufacturing activity was mixed   but showed modest improvement on net during the reporting period of December   through the beginning of January

After accounting for normal seasonal variation, the pace of home sales was mixed   across areas but appeared little changed on net compared with the previous   reporting period; contacts noted that low mortgage interest rates helped to   sustain sales in general
Retail sales improved modestly   but remained somewhat weak on net
Also, the total weight of young   chickens slaughtered was 3 percent higher than the previous November, but   year-to-date totals were 7 percent lower
In general, manufacturing   activity continued to decline while service sector activity increased
Over this period, total deposits increased , percent
Manufacturing   activity has continued to decline since our previous report, with persistent   weakness in employment
Residential real estate   markets are showing signs of improvement in parts of the Eighth District
